results.name: Rotated binary incrementing: For n<2 a(n)=n, if n=(2^k)-1, a(n)=(n+1)/2, otherwise a(n)=n+1.
comment: A002487(n)/A002487(n+1), n > 0, runs through all the reduced nonnegative rationals exactly once. A002487 is the Stern's sequence. A002487(a(n)) = A002487(n+1) n>0 . - _Yosu Yurramendi_, Jul 07 2016
link: A. Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2047
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
maple: a := n -> if n < 2 then n elif convert(convert(n+1, base, 2), `+`) = 1 then (n+1)/2 else n+1 fi: seq(a(n), n=0..71); # _Peter Luschny_, Jul 16 2016
mathematica: Table[If[IntegerQ@ Log2[n + 1], (n + 1)/2, n + 1], {n, 0, 71}] /. _Rational -> 0 (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 13 2016 *)
program: (MIT Scheme:) (define (A153152 n) (cond ((< n 2) n) ((pow2? (1+ n)) (/ (1+ n) 2)) (else (1+ n))))
def a(n): return n if n<2 else (n + 1)/2 if ok(n + 1) else n + 1 # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 09 2017
